summary: The European Systemic Risk Board (ESRB) is a pivotal institution within the EU framework, established to oversee and mitigate systemic risks to the financial stability of the Union. It operates under the regulatory auspices of the European Union, focusing on the identification, prevention, and mitigation of risks that could jeopardize the free movement of capital. The ESRB employs a macroprudential approach, coordinating with national authorities to ensure a cohesive regulatory response to emerging threats. Its role is crucial in fostering a resilient financial system, thereby safeguarding the integrity of the internal market and promoting sustainable economic growth across member states.
